courses.name: Graphics
courses.description: Graphics is an upper level elective for those pursuing the graphics vector.

courses.name: Object Oriented Programming
courses.description: OOP is required major level class. Learn how to implement some basic data structures and algorithms.

courses.name: Python
courses.description:
Python is the introductory CS class.
Learn about the basics of CS and make the game brick breaker

courses.name: Databases
courses.description: Learn how to store data and expand on your knowledge of data structures

courses.name: Artifical Intelligence
courses.description: Often in demand, AI is difficult to get into! Learn about the fundamentals of AI

courses.name: Game Design
courses.description: Become the next great game maker. This course is intense. But it is so worth it.

courses.name: Networks
courses.description: Even though most people use it as a liberal study, network science is powerful!

courses.name: Data Driven Web Applications
courses.description: Get a taste of D3 and some JS to add to your backend knowledge!

courses.name: Compilers
courses.description: This class makes you legit. This class is your life.

courses.name: Operating Systems
courses.description: This is one of the most important courses. You can finally understand synchronization.

advisors.name: Michael Clarkson
advisors.description: He's known for teaching 3110 and is interested in security.

advisors.name: Walker White
advisors.description: He's known for teaching 1110 and is interested in game design.

advisors.name: Anne Bracy
advisors.description: She's known for teaching 3410 and has worked at Intel.

advisors.name: Daisy Fan
advisors.description: She's known for teaching 1112 and applies CS to environmental engineering.

advisors.name: Kavita Bala
advisors.description: She's known for teaching 4620 and is passionate about graphics.

advisors.name: Andrew Myers
advisors.description: He's known for teaching 2112 and he runs the CMS team.

advisors.name: David Gries
advisors.description: He's known for teaching 2110 and he was present at the first SWE conference.

advisors.name: Michael George
advisors.description: He's known for teaching 2800 and he completed his PhD at Cornell.

advisors.name: Jon Kleinberg
advisors.description: He's known for teaching 2850 and also upper level network science classes.

summer_plans.name: Internship at Facebook
summer_plans.description: You are an intern on the Facebook messenger team

summer_plans.name: Internship at Jane Street Capital
summer_plans.description: You are an intern at Jane Street Capital and you are using OCaml to develop trading algorithms

summer_plans.name: Research at Cornell
summer_plans.description: You are spending the summer at Cornell researching under your favorite professor.

summer_plans.name: Research at UMass Amherst
summer_plans.description: You are spending the summer at UMass researching under a famous professor.

summer_plans.name: Internship at a startup
summer_plans.description: You are working at a new startup in SF that just got angel investors

summer_plans.name: Internship at Microsoft
summer_plans.description: You are working at Microsoft on the Cortana team. You're hoping to meet Bill Gates

summer_plans.name: Taking classes at Cornell
summer_plans.description: You are trying to catch up on your degree and thus must take classes over the summer

summer_plans.name: Personal Project
summer_plans.description: You are embarking on a personal project. Great things are expected

summer_plans.name: Traveling
summer_plans.description: You are traveling this summer. You're visiting Prague, Hong Kong, Seoul, New Delhi among other places

summer_plans.name: Teaching a coding class
summer_plans.description: You are teaching middle and high school kids introductory computer science!

future_plans.name: Industry-Big Corp
future_plans.description: You are working at a large corporation like Google, Facebook or Amazon.

future_plans.name: MEng at Cornell
future_plans.description: You returned to Cornell for an MEng. Then you plan to pursue industry.

future_plans.name: Industry-Start Up
future_plans.description: You are working at a startup that is about to IPO

future_plans.name: Masters at Cornell
future_plans.description: You are pursuing your masters at Cornell for two years

future_plans.name: PhD at University of California, Berkeley
future_plans.description: You are pursuing a PhD in artifical intelligence at Berkeley!

future_plans.name: Investment Banking
future_plans.description: You took your business minor and CS major and went into I-banking

action.description: You get to choose between Arts and Sciences or Engineering.
You got a 100 on your first CS assignment. Congratulations! You get 500 points.
You need to choose an advisor. You also get karma points.
Congratulations! You have graduated!! Now you get to choose your post-Cornell plans. You also get karma points.
